Aspirin.cds_optimization: Improve Permeability (score: 50/100); Improve Safety (score: 55/100);   - Address: Clinical toxicity risk (0.74)
Aspirin.cds_benchmark_comparison: MW: outside typical range (180.2); Logp: in IQR (1.3, range 1.2-3.8); TPSA: in IQR (63.6, range 50-110); Rotatable Bonds: favorable (2, median=5)
Aspirin.bcs_description: High solubility, high permeability - favorable for oral delivery
Aspirin.bcs_formulation_strategies: Conventional immediate-release tablets; Simple capsule formulations; Oral solutions or suspensions
Aspirin.bcs_formulation_considerations: Biowaivers eligible (FDA/EMA) - in vitro dissolution sufficient; Excipient selection is flexible; Standard direct compression or wet granulation
Aspirin.bcs_recommended_excipients: Fillers: Microcrystalline cellulose (MCC), Lactose monohydrate; Binders: PVP K30, HPMC E5; Disintegrants: Croscarmellose sodium, Sodium starch glycolate
Aspirin.comparative_strengths: LogP in optimal range (1.3); Molecular weight in optimal range (180.2); TPSA in optimal range (63.6); Strong Absorption profile (score: 81/100); Better LogP than similar drugs (1.3 vs avg 2.6 in Warfarin)
Aspirin.bro5_recommendations: Ro5-compliant: standard oral formulation approaches applicable

Simvastatin.cardiotoxicity_factors: LogP in hERG range (3.31); MW in hERG range (421)
Simvastatin.cds_regulatory_flags: ICH S10: lipophilic with low TPSA — phototoxicity assessment recommended
Simvastatin.cds_benchmark_comparison: MW: in IQR (420.5, range 270-450); Logp: in IQR (3.3, range 1.2-3.8); TPSA: in IQR (93.1, range 50-110); Rotatable Bonds: higher than typical (6, median=5)
Simvastatin.bcs_description: Low solubility, high permeability - dissolution rate-limited absorption
Simvastatin.bcs_formulation_strategies: Amorphous solid dispersions (spray-dried or hot-melt extrusion); Nanocrystal/nanosuspension technology; Lipid-based drug delivery systems (SEDDS/SMEDDS); Cyclodextrin inclusion complexes
Simvastatin.bcs_formulation_considerations: Dissolution is the rate-limiting step; Supersaturation maintenance is critical; Consider precipitation inhibitors (HPMC, PVP)
Simvastatin.bcs_recommended_excipients: Solubilizers: Polysorbate 80, Cremophor EL; Polymeric Carriers: HPMC-AS, PVP-VA (Kollidon VA64); Lipid Carriers: Capryol 90, Gelucire 44/14
Simvastatin.metabolism_soft_spots: Ester hydrolysis (carboxylesterase-mediated); Terminal (omega) hydroxylation of alkyl chain; Epoxidation of olefinic double bond
Simvastatin.comparative_strengths: LogP in optimal range (3.3); Molecular weight in optimal range (420.5); TPSA in optimal range (93.1); Strong Drug-likeness profile (score: 75/100)
Simvastatin.bro5_recommendations: Ro5-compliant: standard oral formulation approaches applicable
Simvastatin.aop_1_name: Androgen receptor antagonism leading to male reproductive dysfunction
Simvastatin.aop_2_name: Mitochondrial dysfunction leading to liver injury
Simvastatin.aop_3_name: Estrogen receptor agonism leading to reproductive effects
Simvastatin.aop_4_name: Reactive oxygen species generation leading to glomerular injury
Simvastatin.aop_4_mie: Mitochondrial electron transport chain disruption in podocytes

Cyclosporine A.muegge_details: Fail (MW: 1159.61 (range: 200-600); TPSA: 249.7 > 150; Aromatic rings: 0 (range: 2-7); Rotatable bonds: 16 > 15; HBA: 11 > 10)
Cyclosporine A.cardiotoxicity_factors: LogP in hERG range (4.40); Basic nitrogen atoms (10)
Cyclosporine A.cds_optimization: Improve Physicochemical (score: 0/100);   - Address: Very high MW (1160 Da); Improve Metabolic stability (score: 30/100);   - Address: High MW (1160) — increased metabolic sites; Improve Permeability (score: 30/100)
Cyclosporine A.cds_regulatory_flags: Regulatory: 2 Ro5 violations — bioavailability justification needed
Cyclosporine A.cds_benchmark_comparison: MW: outside typical range (1159.6); Logp: acceptable (4.4); TPSA: outside typical range (249.7); Rotatable Bonds: higher than typical (16, median=5)
Cyclosporine A.bcs_description: Low solubility, low permeability - significant formulation challenges
Cyclosporine A.bcs_formulation_strategies: Amorphous nanoparticle formulations; Lipid nanoparticles (SLN, NLC); Polymeric micelles or nanocapsules; Prodrug strategy (improve both S and P)
Cyclosporine A.bcs_formulation_considerations: Both dissolution AND permeation are rate-limiting; Oral bioavailability typically <30%; Advanced formulation technology required
Cyclosporine A.bcs_recommended_excipients: Nanocarriers: PLGA nanoparticles, Lipid nanocapsules; Complexation: HP-β-cyclodextrin, SBE-β-cyclodextrin (Captisol); Advanced Lipids: Self-emulsifying systems, Microemulsions
Cyclosporine A.metabolism_soft_spots: N-demethylation (removal of N-CH3); N-dealkylation (general alkyl removal); Allylic hydroxylation (alpha to double bond); Terminal (omega) hydroxylation of alkyl chain; N-oxidation of tertiary amine
Cyclosporine A.ddi_clinical_warnings: Moderate CYP3A4 inhibitor - 2-5 fold AUC increase in CYP3A4 substrates
Cyclosporine A.ddi_monitoring: Caution with narrow TI CYP3A4 substrates: Tacrolimus, Cyclosporine
Cyclosporine A.ddi_induction_risk: Possible PXR activation (high LogP + MW profile)
Cyclosporine A.ddi_known_interactions: Sildenafil (CYP3A4 moderate inhibition): Hypotension — reduce dose to 25mg; Apixaban (CYP3A4 moderate inhibition): Bleeding risk — dose adjustment
Cyclosporine A.comparative_weaknesses: Molecular weight too high (1159.6, optimal: 150-500); TPSA too high (249.7, optimal: 20-140); Weak Absorption profile (score: 18/100); Higher LogP than similar drugs (4.4 vs avg 2.5 in Mycophenolate mofetil); Higher MW than similar drugs (1159.6 vs avg 433.5 in Mycophenolate mofetil)
Cyclosporine A.bro5_protac_assessment: Strengths: Good Fsp3 supports 3D shape diversity; Chameleonic character may enable cell permeability
Cyclosporine A.bro5_recommendations: N-methylation of backbone NH groups may reduce TPSA and improve membrane permeability; Macrocyclic compound: may exhibit chameleonic behavior enabling oral bioavailability despite bRo5 properties (Driggers et al., 2008); PROTAC optimization: explore shorter/rigid linkers to reduce MW and improve oral exposure
Cyclosporine A.aop_1_name: Mitochondrial dysfunction leading to liver injury
Cyclosporine A.aop_2_name: Reactive oxygen species generation leading to glomerular injury
Cyclosporine A.aop_2_mie: Mitochondrial electron transport chain disruption in podocytes

ARV-110.hepatotoxicity_factors: High LogP (5.47); High MW (658); Multiple aromatic rings (4)
ARV-110.cardiotoxicity_factors: Basic nitrogen atoms (5); Multiple aromatic rings (4)
ARV-110.carcinogenicity_factors: High bioaccumulation potential (LogP=5.47); Polycyclic aromatic structure (4 rings); Toxic structural alerts
ARV-110.cds_critical_liabilities: Severe metabolic instability; Unfavorable physicochemical properties; Cardiac liability (hERG)
ARV-110.cds_optimization: Improve Physicochemical (score: 0/100);   - Address: Very high MW (658 Da); Improve Metabolic stability (score: 5/100);   - Address: High LogP (5.5) — metabolic instability risk;   - Address: High MW (658) — increased metabolic sites
ARV-110.cds_regulatory_flags: Regulatory: 2 Ro5 violations — bioavailability justification needed
ARV-110.cds_benchmark_comparison: MW: outside typical range (657.7); Logp: outside typical range (5.5); TPSA: acceptable (122.8); Rotatable Bonds: higher than typical (11, median=5)
ARV-110.bcs_description: Low solubility, low permeability - significant formulation challenges
ARV-110.bcs_formulation_strategies: Amorphous nanoparticle formulations; Lipid nanoparticles (SLN, NLC); Polymeric micelles or nanocapsules; Prodrug strategy (improve both S and P)
ARV-110.bcs_formulation_considerations: Both dissolution AND permeation are rate-limiting; Oral bioavailability typically <30%; Advanced formulation technology required
ARV-110.bcs_recommended_excipients: Nanocarriers: PLGA nanoparticles, Lipid nanocapsules; Complexation: HP-β-cyclodextrin, SBE-β-cyclodextrin (Captisol); Advanced Lipids: Self-emulsifying systems, Microemulsions
ARV-110.metabolism_soft_spots: Aromatic hydroxylation (CYP-mediated); N-dealkylation (general alkyl removal); N-oxidation of tertiary amine; Amide hydrolysis
ARV-110.ddi_clinical_warnings: Moderate CYP3A4 inhibitor - 2-5 fold AUC increase in CYP3A4 substrates
ARV-110.ddi_monitoring: Caution with narrow TI CYP3A4 substrates: Tacrolimus, Cyclosporine
ARV-110.ddi_induction_risk: CYP3A4 induction risk (Rifamycin-like scaffold (potent PXR activator)); CYP2C9 induction risk (Rifamycin-like scaffold (potent PXR activator)); CYP2C19 induction risk (Rifamycin-like scaffold (potent PXR activator))
ARV-110.ddi_known_interactions: Sildenafil (CYP3A4 moderate inhibition): Hypotension — reduce dose to 25mg; Apixaban (CYP3A4 moderate inhibition): Bleeding risk — dose adjustment
ARV-110.comparative_weaknesses: LogP too high (5.5, optimal: -0.5-5.0); Molecular weight too high (657.7, optimal: 150-500); Weak Absorption profile (score: 21/100); Higher LogP than similar drugs (5.5 vs avg 3.5 in Imatinib); Higher MW than similar drugs (657.7 vs avg 493.6 in Imatinib)
ARV-110.aop_1_name: Mitochondrial dysfunction leading to liver injury
ARV-110.aop_2_name: Reactive oxygen species generation leading to glomerular injury
ARV-110.aop_2_mie: Mitochondrial electron transport chain disruption in podocytes
